C* users should care about their application architecture for the simple reason that C* isn’t magic and can’t do everything. Cassandra can’t solve the problem of real-time correlation or reaction at the application layer. Developers have to solve these problems themselves, and Cassandra is just one part of the solution.Event Stream Processing and CEP play nicely with Cassandra, and that’s what we’ll be focusing onIntentionally small and stupid
